title: divers and assassins should be able to 1v1 an adc at any point in the game
body: Adcs are bullshit right now. NERF NERF NERF

replies.body: Assassins and divers generally can 1v1 ADCs at any point in the game. It's just that the supports are usually right next to their ADCs, so it's never 1v1.

Assassins yes, Divers no. 
Most divers are suppose to sacrifice burst for mobility.

While you have a _very_ valid point, let's be fair: Kindred's one of the most fragile champions there are. They _have_ to buy BC to even have the health of a regular ADC.
Why SHOULD they be able to? With lethality most of those can 1v1 an ADC unless they are outplayed. If Lee had that kind of 1v1 power he would be crazy OP.

Why? Why should they always be able to 1v1? If the ADC gets highly fed, or the assassin is behind as fuck, they shouldn't be able to. If the assassin totally misses everything or gets outplayed, the assassin has no right to win the 1v1.

And it's rarely a 1v1. You're often seeing a lot of 1v2s and 1v3s.

And divers sacrifice part of their burst for mobility and durability.
